reviews.review_msg: This professor is out to lunch. She should do everyone a favour and retire.

This was one of my favourite courses.  Most additional time spent on this course involved practicing the skills learned with your classmates.  The professor is approachable and will write references. The class is fun and interactive, so time flies by.

This was hands down one of the best courses I took in my undergraduate studies.  I enjoyed the hands-on learning and I am even more than ever interested in going to graduate school. Gillian was a knowledgeable, kind and compassionate professor. Highly recommend.

Gillian knows her stuff, but you really have to initiate conversations to hear it. Her feedback is minimal unless you're ready to ask questions. For the most part, this is a low-stress course. You'll get a good grade if you put in the work. The textbook is super helpful! I wish she were a bit more involved in the first place.

Really disorganized. Syllabus and readings usually don't match what you're talking about that week. Canvas page is a nightmare to navigate. The class is 90% group work and it's marked fairly leniently, so it's not hard to get a good grade, but every time I had to interact with the prof, it was frustrating.

I have never had a teacher that cared so much about her students - she grades holistically and really does everything she can to make sure you succeed. I believe she's sessional, but if you see her teaching take the class ASAP!
